fringe.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
fringe.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
fringe.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a decorative edge of hanging threads on a curtain, piece of clothing etc
fringe.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to be around the edge of something
fringe.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: A line of trees fringed the pool.
fringe.translation[3].definitions[0].def: the theatre productions in the Edinburgh Festival which are not part of the official programme
fringe.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: a comedian who was a great success at the Fringe
fringe.translation[4].definitions[0].def: relating to something that is in addition to the main or most important part of something
fringe.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The company is a fringe player in the US with less than 2% of the car market.
We were spending a lot of money on the fringe areas that werenâ€™t producing results.
